title: CoVerica Internship | Summer 2024
description:
Description:**About CoVerica Insurance**

  


**WE'RE A MULTI-AWARD-WINNING INSURANCE AGENCY THAT HAS DECIDED TO DO THINGS DIFFERENTLY IN THE MARKET.**

  


Since 1983 CoVerica has been a leader as your Dallas Independent Insurance Agency for Homeowner Insurance, Car Insurance, & Business Insurance. We have always focused on saving our clients money without the worry and claims hassle that comes with the common practice of removing coverages from your policy. Insurance is complex and confusing which is why we successfully navigate the buying process for you.

  


The industry has noticed what we’re doing too which is why we’ve been awarded the Best Practices Agency Award FOUR times in a row from the Independent Insurance Agents Brokers of America. This excellence award is only given to 1 in every 1,088 Insurance Agencies in the United States. About CoVerica For nearly 40 years, CoVerica has offered competitively priced personal and commercial insurance products and risk management solutions. Headquartered in Dallas, Texas, the company has grown to serve businesses and families in 37 states in the southern region of the U.S.

  


CoVerica’s profitability has increased 350% in the last decade due to the application of a unique business model, recruitment of high-quality talent with an entrepreneurial spirit, and leadership’s focus on sustainable growth.

  


**Job Description**

  


This position is your entry point into our company where we work and play hard. We go the extra mile for our customers and our employees. We have been in business for over 25 years. Our company has an already completed succession plan for the next 40 years. We are on the cutting edge of technology, utilizing SalesForce and integrated technologies to simultaneously improve the customer experience and boost operational success.

  


Commercial sales interns work closely with commercial producers, assisting in various tasks. Those tasks include making calls, conducting research, updating databases, attending carrier and client meetings, and learning about the commercial insurance industry, among other tasks.

  


***Do you want to build a long-term, lucrative Career, with a thriving growing company that values their employees and your local community?***

  


  


We have an outstanding opportunity for Sales Interns. As a CoVerica sales intern, you will learn:

* The art of prospecting and appointment setting
* Client meeting preparation
* Sales process from initial appointment to sales victory

  


**ABOUT YOU...**

* **Hard work drives you**, We are one of the largest independent agencies in DFW, to doubleevery 5 years. Intending to double, we need the best and the brightest young professionals who have the grit to accomplish goals.

  


* **Surrounding yourself with the best is important to you**. We consistently interview to find top talent, and only a fraction are offered employment. Being surrounded by a high-performing team makes you better and pushes the company forward.

  


* **Your standards are high.** As a growing company, we’re counting on candidates we hire today to become future leaders as we continue to grow. We want to work with proven self-starters who enjoy a challenge and want to push themselves, and those around them.

  


* **Competing is fun, winning is better.** We constantly strive to set records, and then break them. We are looking for ambitious, hard-working, humble, and fun people to be part of a team environment that celebrates winning. Though we work hard, we also celebrate big through company events, incentives, and competitions.

title: Firewall Admin
description:
**\*This is a hybrid position requiring 2 days a week in office. Must reside in the state of CO on start date. Relocation assistance is not provided. FirstBank does not sponsor work visas.\***

  

**Salary Range**  

  

$90K - $110K  

  

Founded in 1963, FirstBank maintains more than $20 billion in assets and operates over 100 branch locations across Colorado, Arizona and California. Its growth can be attributed to one simple philosophy: do right by customers, communities and employees, which is at the center of the company’s “banking for good” mantra. FirstBank believes that diversity, equity, and inclusion are part of everything we do, both within and outside our company, and prides itself in hiring and training a diverse and talented group. We strive to not only maintain a diverse workforce, but also ensure our employee experience garners a sense of belonging, is inclusive and equitable. FirstBank believes that a company is nothing without the people that comprise it, and prides itself in hiring and training a diverse and talented group. By joining the FirstBank team you will experience its great team culture with ample opportunity for growth. There’s an opportunity for everyone with positions all across the company, from Teller and Call Center to Technology and Lending. Apply today to learn more and join the team!  

  

**A Brief Overview**  

  

Responsibilities include evaluation, design, installation, configuration, operation, and maintenance of enterprise-level next-generation Firewall technologies such as Cisco ASA, , Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS), and Virtual Private Networks (VPN) in an enterprise 24x7 environment. Participate in technical research, documentation and projects with a primary focus on Data Center, Cloud, Campus, and Branch network security. Must be able to participate in after-hours work as required for on-call and system implementations.  

  

**What you will do**


* Provide technical knowledge in the administration and implementation of enterprise-level firewall and intrusion prevention solutions, and virtual private networks, specializing in Cisco ASA and Firepower next-generation firewall technologies.
* Maintain a functional understanding of all aspects of network infrastructure, including Cloud, Data Center, Campus, Wireless (WLAN) and Wide Area Networks (WAN).
* Works on projects/systems/issues of high complexity surrounding network segmentation, intrusion detection and prevention, configuration and optimization.
* Regularly audit firewall configurations for all segments of the network including Data Center, Campus, Wireless and Wide Area Networks.
* Support implementation projects involving existing and new technical solutions; responsibilities include planning, scheduling, and coordinating some aspects of the project.
* Establish, maintain, and troubleshoot virtual private network connections to 3rd party external entities. Provide escalation support for firewall configuration and troubleshooting with the Branch WAN and Campus networks; provide guidance to assist the network admins in resolving problems.
* Make decisions and recommendations to Management as necessary to keep projects on schedule.
* Perform other duties and projects as assigned.
* Understand and comply with all provisions of the Security in the Workplace policy.


**Minimum Requirements**


* Typically requires a bachelor's degree in related field and a minimum of 2 years of related experience. A combination of post-high school education, job related certification and related experience equivalent to 5 years may be considered in lieu of minimum requirements.


**Preferred Requirements**


* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or other technical field
* Experience in administering enterprise-level next-generation Firepower firewall technology with a medium to large organization


**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**


* Strong organizational skills with the ability to balance multiple projects and multiple tasks while meeting agreed upon objectives
* Possess the ability to quickly identify, diagnose and provide solutions to complex problems, requirements and integration of various technologies
* Experience in the principles, design and implementation of TCP/IP networks including OSI model, routing, VLAN’s, QoS tuning and capacity management
* Functional knowledge with layer 2 and layer 3 technologies with a focus on Cisco networking equipment such as firewalls, routers, switches, and network load balancers
* Experience with Data Center and Campus Core firewall design, traffic flow analysis, segmentation, and Implementation
* Able to recommend, implement and maintain security measures on various network devices
* Working knowledge of virtual servers and operating systems
* Working knowledge of encryption technologies, web services and database systems
* Strong customer service skills

  

  

**Working Conditions and Physical Requirements**


* Frequently remains stationary throughout a typical business day
* Frequently operates a computer and other office machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine, and computer printer
* Occasionally moves about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, and other rooms
* Occasionally positions self to access drawers and shelves of various heights
* Frequently reaches for and handles paperwork and files
* Constantly communicates with customers, coworkers, and management in-person and on the phone
* Must be able to exchange accurate information
* FirstBank does not currently offer fully remote positions, except as required by law. The actual number of in-office days that may be required will vary by business unit, role, and business need.
  


**Statement of Benefits**  

  

FirstBank offers a suite of benefits that support our employees’ professional, financial, physical, emotional and spiritual well-being. Benefits currently offered with our positions include: Paid Time Off/paid leave programs, 401K/Employee Stock Ownership, United Healthcare medical, MetLife dental, VSP vision, Employee tuition reimbursement, Volunteer Time Off, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, and Group Life Insurance/AD&D  

  

FirstBank is an EOE/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other applicable status protected by state or local law. FirstBank does not permit pay inequities. Anyone who believes they have been subject to pay inequity should immediately report their concerns to the Human Resource Department.


**\*This opportunity is expected to close by 3/29\***


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Cyber Security Architect
description:
Hunter Douglas is the world’s leading manufacturer of window coverings and a major manufacturer of architectural products. We are a brand that you know and trust. With more than 100 years of innovation, we’ve defined our industry with proprietary products that deliver revolutionary style and functionality and can be found in millions of homes and commercial buildings globally.



We are searching for candidates that are driven, intelligent, creative, and entrepreneurial. By offering challenging and accelerated opportunities for growth, powered by a shared hunger for success, we create a space for your career to thrive. In return for your expertise, we are committed to providing competitive and robust total compensation and benefit packages to ensure you feel valued. Our dream is to become the fastest growing, most loved, window covering company in the world. *What’s yours?*

**Position Overview**



Responsible for design, procurement, and implementation of Cybersecurity capabilities within the Hunter Douglas Cybersecurity program.


**What you'll do**



An employee in this position may be called upon to do any or all of the following essential functions. (These examples do not include all of the functions which the employee may be expected to perform.)


* Develop requirements for vendor selection for new and replacement technologies within the Information Security footprint.
* Partner with procurement, legal, and compliance teams on behalf of Cybersecurity to ensure timely acquisition of Cybersecurity tools and effective financial management of the Cybersecurity budget.
* Build and align processes and procedures as well as network and system standards to the company’s IT security policies.
* Monitor the on-boarding of technology related projects to make sure that they align with the company’s security policies, guidelines and ISP process.
* The candidate will need to work with all parties to include project sponsors, vendors and IT operations groups.
* Partners with the rest of the IT organization to ensure effective implementation and ongoing management of security tools, systems and processes including: logging, IDS, IPS, endpoint protection, web filtering, MDM, DLP, patch management, vulnerability scanning technologies, etc.
* Partner with the infrastructure team to develop strong security posturing including reviewing firewall policies and propose changes such as additional network segmentation and filtering policies to better protect the network.
* Interfaces with management and user community to understand business needs, implement security best practices, and identify opportunities for improving security and compliance.
* Partners with the training and professional development staff to promote security awareness among the user community.
* Review and develop the company’s overall security program and manage multiple security projects in a given period.
* Ability to work in a constant state of alertness and safe manner.
* Position requires regular and predictable attendance.
* Employees are held accountable for all duties of this job.


**Who you are**



An employee in this position, upon appointment, should have the equivalent of the following:


* **CISSP**, SSCP or GSEC Security Certification required.
* **Expert knowledge** of security best practices (encryption, data protection, design, privilege access, etc.).
* **Expert knowledge** and experience with managing and implementing standard security technologies (DLP, MDM, SIEM, AV, IDS).
* **Expert knowledge** in compliance management and certification (PCI, GDPR, CCPA).
* **Solid knowledge** of networks technologies (protocols, design concepts, access control). **Expert knowledge** to demonstrateexcellent written and verbal communications.
* **Expert knowledge** and proficiency in planning, reporting, establishing goals and objectives, standards, priorities and schedules.
* **Acceptable Training and Experience** includes Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in related field. Minimum of 5 years’ experience as an Information Security Architect


**LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES**


* The following competencies have been abbreviated; refer to IT Leadership Performance Appraisal to view the full version
* **Adaptability/Flexibility/Responsiveness -** Maintains a positive outlook and responds constructively when presented with challenge and change.
* **Business Savvy –** Demonstrates leading edge knowledge of developments in their professional/technical area.
* **Critical Thinking –** Anticipates events and potential problems before they arise.
* **Decision Making/Judgment –** Applies a sound knowledge of procedures and organizational values when making decisions.
* **Drive for Results -** Sets, pursues and achieves aggressive goals and targets.
* **Driving Strategic Direction -** Effectively allocates human and financial resources necessary to achieve strategic objectives.
* **Leading Teams** – Allows people to manage his or her own project, team, or functions with autonomy.


**What's in it for you**


* Annual base salary range: $136k - $179k
* Bonus target range: 35-45%
* Generous benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life, disability
* A company culture that prioritizes internal development and professional growth
* Time off with pay
* 401(k) plan with a degree of employer matching
* Paid parental leave
* Wellness programs and product discounts

  


*Please note, all offers presented to candidates are carefully crafted to ensure market competitiveness, equity, and reflect the individual candidate’s education, experience, skills and potential.*


*#LI-KL1*


Hunter Douglas is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with applicable employment laws. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled are encouraged to apply.

title: Lead Cybersecurity Engineer
description:
Creating Peace of Mind by Pioneering Safety and Security
At Allegion, we help keep the people you know and love safe and secure where they live, work and visit. With more than 30 brands, 12,000+ employees globally and products sold in 130 countries, we specialize in security around the doorway and beyond.
As the Lead Cybersecurity Engineer, you will be a security engineering leader for Allegion’s next generation IoT platform connecting Allegion’s electromechanical locks and access control systems for Residential and Commercial environments. In this role, you will be a key contributor to a team of cross-functional product development engineers by driving improvements to our IoT platform’s security posture.
What You Will Do:* Lead effort to obtain and maintain SoC2 Type 2 compliance for our IoT platform
* Identify and communicate security gaps as well as best practices based on SoC2 compliance as actionable work items to the development teams
* Collaborate with product management, architecture, and product security teams to elicit and manage our IoT platform’s security requirements
* Identify, analyze and communicate program risks related to security and compliance
* Regularly review and evaluate our IoT platform’s security posture with Allegion’s Product Security Team
* Contribute to defining confidentiality, integrity, and availability of interface control documents (ICDs) for next generation Allegion devices connecting to Allegion’s IoT platform
* Contribute to the Agile Release Train (ART) PI Planning ceremony, ensuring the agile software teams can meet the delivery needs required by the business and cybersecurity
* Provide clear communication to technical team members as well as to other leaders and managers
* Coordinate ongoing security monitoring, logging, and response for the IoT platform
* As the IoT platform matures the responsibility may increase in scope to provide cybersecurity support for other Allegion software programs


What You Need to Succeed:* BS in Systems Engineering, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or related field
* At least 8 years’ experience in IoT devices, access control, consumer products, automotive, aerospace, or medical
* You have demonstrated experience leading project teams to deliver complex programs
* You bring strong engineering project management skills, including: planning and organization, stakeholder management, risk management, change management, and clear communication
* You can communicate effectively with both business leaders and development engineers
* You have experience with analyzing and decomposing compliance controls for SOC2 certification or other similar industry recognized certifications.
* You are self-directed with high initiative and high achievement goals
* You have knowledge of cybersecurity methods and protocols, experience with cloud service architectures (AWS, Azure) and mobile SDKs
* You can provide technical coaching and mentoring
* You have experience in Systems Engineering processes including design by requirements, traceability, and verification and validation
* Travel requirements: 10%


Why Work for Us?
Allegion is a Great Place to Grow your Career if:
You're seeking a rewarding opportunity that allows you to truly help others. With thousands of employees and customers around the world, there’s plenty of room to make an impact. As our values state, “this is your business, run with it”.
You’re looking for a company that will invest in your professional development. As we grow, we want you to grow with us.
You want a culture that promotes work-life balance. Our employees enjoy generous paid time off, because at Allegion we recognize that you have a full life outside of work!
What You’ll Get from Us:
Health, dental and vision insurance coverage, helping you “be safe, be healthy”
Unlimited Paid Time Off
A commitment to your future with a 401K plan, which currently offers a 6% company match and no vesting period
Health Savings Accounts – Tax-advantaged savings account used for healthcare expenses
Flexible Spending Accounts – Tax-advantaged spending accounts for healthcare and/or dependent daycare expenses
Disability Insurance –Short-Term and Long-Term coverage, paid for by Allegion, provides income replacement for illness or injury
Life Insurance – Term life coverage with the option to purchase supplemental coverage
Tuition Reimbursement
Voluntary Wellness Program – Simply complete wellness activities and earn up to $2,000 in rewards
Employee Discounts through *Perks at Work*
Community involvement and opportunities to give back so you can “serve others, not yourself”
Opportunities to leverage your unique strengths through CliftonStrengths assessment & coaching
Compensation:
This range is provided by Allegion. Your actual salary will be based on your skills and experience, along with other factors.* The expected Base Salary Range: $95,000 - $176,700. The actual compensation will be determined based on experience and other factors permitted by law.
* Bonus Eligible: Yes


Apply Today!
Join our team of experts today and help us make tomorrow’s world a safer place!*Not sure if your experience perfectly aligns with the role?* *Studies have shown that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification* *and* *every single preferred qualification of a job posting. At Allegion, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every item in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this role.*
We Celebrate Who We Are!
Allegion is committed to building and maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. Together, we embrace all differences and similarities among colleagues, as well as the differences and similarities within the relationships that we foster with customers, suppliers and the communities where we live and work. Whatever your background, experience, race, color, national origin, religion, age, gender, gender identity, disability status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law, we will make sure that you have every opportunity to impress us in your application and the opportunity to give your best at work, not because we’re required to, but because it’s the right thing to do. We are also committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If for any reason you cannot apply through our career site and require an accommodation or assistance, please contact our Talent Acquisition Team.

title: Cyber Threat Hunter
company: Hood Engineering and Consulting Services, LLC
description:

title: Staff Internal Auditor
description:
**Reporting to:** Director, Internal Audit
**Location:** Denver, CO (Hybrid)
**Application deadline:** All applications are due by 4pm MST on Friday, February 16th, 2024
*At Inspirato, we are committed to promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion in all we do—in our workplace, our business initiatives, our marketing, and the causes we support. As an innovator in the industry, we also recognize the valuable role diverse perspectives play in keeping us on the cutting edge of our business. Together we span ages, abilities, cultures, races, religions, gender identities, and sexual orientations. We not only embrace those differences, we celebrate them.*
Founded in 2011, Inspirato has continued to foster a culture built off innovation, curiosity, and entrepreneurial spirit. At Inspirato, we’re passionate about delivering incredible vacation and travel experiences for our members and their guests. We pride ourselves on providing a fun and healthy workplace with an open-door policy. Here, there’s no doubt you’ll be working alongside a team of smart, diverse, and driven individuals who love what they do. We take great pleasure in helping our employees enrich their lives through travel, grow their career, and provide an environment that fosters collaboration and transparency. **We are on a mission:** To inspire lasting memories and relationships by changing the way family and friends experience the world.
**Job Summary**  

  

**Job Duties and Responsibilities**  

Inspirato’s Internal Audit Department is looking for a Staff Internal Auditor. The Staff Internal Auditor will work with the Director of Internal Audit, Senior Internal Auditor, and members of the co-sourced Internal Audit team to evaluate business risk and the efficiency and effectiveness of Inspirato’s internal controls. This role will be responsible for carrying out Sarbanes Oxley (SOX) activities related to both financial and IT general controls (ITGC’s). This includes planning and scoping activities, control testing and documentation, and follow-up control testing. In addition, the Staff Internal Auditor will assist the Senior Auditor in performing other financial, operational, and fraud-related audits as required. The Staff Auditor will work to integrate feedback from the Director of Internal Audit and Senior Internal Auditor to grow in this role. The Staff Internal Auditor will have the opportunity to build relationships with various Inspirato teams to develop and sustain the image and perceived value of Internal Audit. The Staff Internal Auditor should have a strong intellectual curiosity and the ability to quickly learn new and complex business processes.
**Requirements:**
* Bachelor’s degree in accounting or related field
* CPA/CIA/CISA preferred or in progress
* 2+ years’ experience in public accounting and/or working for large public companies in an audit role
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel
* Experience with change management and competing priorities
* Outstanding analytical, organizational, project/process management skills
* Experience in a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills - demonstrated ability to successfully partner with peers and other departments


**Location:** This role will be located at Inspirato headquarters in downtown Denver: 1544 Wazee St, Denver, CO 80202. At Inspirato we value collaboration and flexibility; we offer a hybrid work environment where employees may work remotely up to three days a week.
**Compensation** - $70,000- $90,000  

We believe in building a compensation structure that reflects the comparable market pay rate for positions at companies similar in size, revenue generation and geographic location; in addition to individual factors including seniority, performance-based merit, education/training and experience related to scope of responsibilities.  

  

**Benefits** – This position is eligible for a health and welfare benefits package including medical, dental & vision insurance.  

  

**401k Retirement Plan** – This position is eligible to participate in the company’s 401k retirement plan.  

  

**Flexible Paid Time Off** – This position is eligible for flexible paid time off. At Inspirato, we believe in taking personal responsibility for managing and balancing our individual time off with our workload and results. Instead of accruing or being granted a specific number of days per year, employees have the flexibility to manage their time out of the office.  

\*Individuals based in California are eligible for a paid time off policy in which PTO is accrued each pay period.  

  

**FAM Trip** – This Position is eligible for the Employee Familiarization Travel Program following three (3) consecutive months of employment. This program provides you up to one seven (7) day reservation in an eligible Inspirato property per your employment calendar year – subject to seasonal property demands and the company Employee Familiarization Travel Program Terms and Conditions.  

  

California applicants can access Inspirato’s California Applicant and Employee Privacy Policy here: https://www.inspirato.com/legal-pages/california-applicants/
*Internal applications will not be accepted beyond the deadline listed.*

title: Information Systems Security Officer / COMSEC Custodian
description:
Position: Information Systems Security Officer / COMSEC Custodian
  

8392 S Continental Divide Rd.
  

Suite 109
  

Littleton, CO  

  

  

  

  

  

Join our team of innovators and get a chance to work alongside a team of talented, curious people that are passionate about designing and deploying solutions that are accelerating humanity’s expansion into space.
**Summary:**
We are hiring for an Information Security Officer (ISSO) / COMSEC Custodian. The ISSO provides support for the program, organization, information system, or network enclave Information Assurance (IA) program. The ISSO maintains operational security posture for assigned information system(s) or program(s) to ensure information systems security policies, standards, and procedures are established and followed. The ISSO assists with the management of security aspects of the information system and perform day-to-day security operations of the system.
**Responsibilities:**
* Reports to the Information System Security Manager (ISSM) and works closely with the Facility Security Team.
* Prepare and review Authorization to Operate (ATO) documentation to include Systems Security Plans (SSPs), the Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M), Risk Assessment Reports, Certification and Accreditation (C&A) packages, and System Control Traceability Matrices (SCTMs); support security authorization activities in compliance with NSA/CSS Information System Certification and Accreditation Process (NISCAP) and DoD Risk Management Framework (RMF) and DoD Information Assurance System Certification and Accreditation Process (DIACAP).
* Maintain configuration management (CM) documentation for information system security software, hardware, and firmware; manage changes to system and assess the security impact of those changes.
* Serve as Information Security representative on Configuration Change Boards (CCB).
* Maintain Continuous Monitoring (CM) Program for assigned systems to include vulnerability scans and audit log validations.
* Conduct cybersecurity related training for system users.
* Serve as Trusted Agent for assigned systems.
* Work with System Administrators to define, implement, and test security controls.
* Document security events and incidents in coordination with Facility Security Office.
* Manages the corporate COMSEC account and oversees Local Element custodians.
* Serves as media control officer for the IT team and is a Data Transfer agent.
* Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, benchmarking state-of-the-art practices, and participating in professional societies.


**Ideal Experience:**
* Bachelor’s degree or higher in cybersecurity, information security or related field with 2 years of experience or equivalent experience.
* Currently holds a Top-Secret Clearance with SCI eligibility.

title: SUMMER INTERNSHIP: AI Security Engineer Intern
Military Service - U.S. Navy, Cyber Warfare Technician
Creative Intern
description:
**Introduction:**

We are a leading, national consulting firm that provides compassionate, full-spectrum emergency management services including planning and preparedness, response, recovery, and mitigation services to the public and private sectors before, during and after a natural disaster or catastrophic event. 

Our mission is to provide compassionate consulting services to local, state, federal, and industry clients, active in disaster response, recovery, and preparedness. We will be on time, on target, and on budget with the services aligned to the evolving threats and hazards facing our nation. 

**Position Summary:** 

* Job Title: Creative Intern
* Full Time or Part Time: PT
* Temporary/Seasonal/Regular: Regular
* Compensation: $18/hour
* Location: Remote/Anywhere in US

**Mission of Role/Position Summary:** 

The Creative Intern is responsible for staying abreast of design trends and social media best practices, ensuring that our brand remains relevant and competitive in a dynamic digital landscape. 

This dual graphics/communications role is perfect for a college student or recent grad who is a “communicative creative”! This role involves the creation of engaging, innovative, and visually appealing graphics and multimedia content that resonates with our internal and external stakeholders, enhances industry presence, and drives engagement. You will work closely with our marketing and communications team to elevate ACDC’s brand identity (with a fresh new rebrand!) through storytelling and impactful visuals in marketing materials, various social media platforms, website content, proposal graphics, and internal communications. 

**Requirements**

**Tasks, Duties and Responsibilities** 

* **Graphic Design:** Lend your talents to the day-to-day marketing machinery, from designing a wide variety of marketing materials to keeping our collateral libraries organized and up to date.
* **Brand Ambassador:** Represent and promote ACDC’s values by embodying our corporate identity through internal and external deliverables.
* **Innovative Content Creation:** Producing engaging written, graphic, and/or video content that resonates with our audience across various platforms. Contribute creatively to the conception and rollout of eye-catching social media campaigns.
* **Social Media Vigilance:** Keep a keen eye on ACDC's social media platforms, spotting and seizing opportunities for meaningful engagement.
* **Trend Research:** Dive into the latest trends in social media and marketing, bringing fresh insights to fuel our team's strategic goals and objectives.
* **Advocacy Planning:** Collaborate in crafting a robust social media advocacy blueprint, amplifying our brand's voice and reach.
* **Strategy Collaboration:** Work hand-in-hand with our MarCom team to brainstorm and implement cutting-edge digital growth strategies.
* **Project Engagement:** Tackle other diverse projects and tasks that bolster our overarching marketing and communication strategies.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:** 

* Possesses a flair for creative expression, both in storytelling and visually/graphically.
* Is digitally savvy, with a finger on the pulse of the latest social media and marketing trends.
* Ability to clearly convey data and storylines through data visualization and infographics.
* Exhibits a strong desire to learn and contribute to a team-focused environment.
* Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and written.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality with sensitive company and operational information.
* Multi-tasking pro.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with a multitude of teams.
* Ability to remain flexible and adapt quickly to changes in roles and ongoing projects.
* Is genuinely passionate about ACDC's mission and eager to amplify our message.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams).

**Experience/Education** Required:

* Working knowledge of Canva
* Working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suites (InDesign, Photoshop, etc.)
* 6 months of experience managing social media platforms through publishing tools such as Hootsuite, HubSpot, etc. (combination of multiple internships/experiences counts)

**Experience/Education** Preferred: 

* Currently enrolled or recently graduated from a Graphic Design, Marketing, Media Studies, Digital Media, Advertising, Public Relations program.
* 1 yr. of Canva
* 1 yr. Adobe Creative Suites experience (InDesign, Photoshop, etc.)
* 1 yr. of experience managing social media platforms through publishing tools such as Hootsuite, HubSpot, etc.
* Familiar with deciphering and leveraging SEO/social analytics to enhance visibility and performance.
* Experience with multimedia projects involving video or animation.
* Experience with / understanding of SEO

**Expected Hours of Work:** 

Schedule may vary. Work on evenings and weekends may be required. 

**Travel Requirements:** 

* None.

**Physical Demands:** 

* Sitting or standing for hours at a time.
* Ability to work at a computer for prolonged periods of time as needed
* Ability to maneuver up to 25 lbs. repetitively throughout the day and as needed.

**Additional Qualifications:** 

* Must be 18 years of age or older.
* Must pass company and any applicable client background check and reference check upon offer of employment.
* Eligibility to work in the United States is required.

**Benefits**

This position is not benefits eligible.

**EEO Statement**

*AC Disaster Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to engaging a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.*

 *This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. AC Disaster Consulting will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any protected characteristic.*

*Please redact or remove information that identifies applicant's age, date of birth, or dates of attendance at (or graduation from) an educational institution from the resume or other application documents prior to submitting the application.*

*If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to access job openings or apply for a job on this site as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodation by contacting AC Disaster Consulting Human Resources team at hr@acdisaster.com.*

*We use E-Verify for all candidates who are offered and accept a position with us. Please visit this link to the* *E-Verify Website* *and this link to view the* *E-Verify rights poster* *to understand your rights in this process.*

title: Intern
description:
**About Matrix:** Matrix Design Group, Inc., an employee-owned planning, engineering and environmental consulting firm is actively seeking an intern to support our Colorado Springs, Denver, Phoenix, and San Antonio offices. As an employee-owned company we are committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, respect and excellence.

 

Our strengths of service, innovation, and skill are a result of that belief. We have a friendly, collegial, cooperative atmosphere. Matrix employees are encouraged to participate in **employee wellness programs**, **social committees** and **community outreach programs**. We strive to employ highly motivated people with excellent communication and applied problem-solving skills who desire to advance their talents and skills.

 

Internships are available year-round and offer both part-time and full-time status. Internships are available in the following cities:

* Denver, CO
* Colorado Springs, CO
* Phoenix, AZ
* San Antonio, TX

 

To apply, students must submit a copy of their Resume and Cover Letter. Any incomplete applications will not be considered. The cover letter should state:

* Available start date
* City you are applying to
* Why you chose this internship opportunity
* What you expect to gain from the experience

 

**Pay Range:** $22.00 Hourly. Pay will be dependent upon experience.

  


**Job Summary:**

Matrix Design Group’s Internship program is a collaborative 10-week paid program that allows students to gain unparalleled exposure into the practicing principles within a multidisciplinary firm.

 

Designed for Juniors, Seniors and Graduate Students interested in a career in Civil Engineering, GIS, Water Resources and Watershed Sciences, Ecological Services, Construction Management, Planning, Environmental Services and Landscape Architecture, each student will work directly with a manager/director on a variety of projects. 

 

Planning, designing, and field work play crucial roles in providing students with a 360-degree approach and infusing real world experiences into education. While interning you will gain experience with tools such as AutoCAD, Civil 3-D, Bluebeam, ArcGIS and other industry specific tools relevant to your responsibilities. 

 

 

**Education and Experience:**

* Must be enrolled in a degree program closely related to Civil Engineering, GIS, Water Resources and Watershed Sciences, Ecological Services, Construction Management, Planning, Environmental Services, or Landscape Architecture.
* Must be a Junior or Senior in an undergraduate program OR currently enrolled in a Master’s/PhD program.

 

**Other Duties:**

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

  


**Physical Demands:**

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.

 

The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

 

Matrix Design Group, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, gender, color, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veteran status, and will not be discriminated against based on disability. 

 

The final agreed upon compensation is based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. 

 

Any applicant with a qualifying physical or mental disability who believes s/he requires a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process should contact us at 719-575-0100 for assistance. 

 

**How to Apply:**

Please apply online at http://www.matrixdesigngroup.com/careers

title: Construction Intern
description:
***Construction Intern***

Tribal 1 is a rapidly growing company focused on providing a full array of construction/architecture/engineering services to the federal government. Our customers include the Department of Defense, U.S. Department of Agriculture, U.S. Forest Service, National Park Service, Bureau of Indian Affairs and other federal and state agencies. As a member of our team, you will get exciting opportunities to participate in the assessment, planning, design, construction or repair of government facilities and infrastructure.

The purpose of the TRIBAL1 Internship is to provide a student who is currently enrolled in a college degree-seeking program an opportunity to gain work experience skills and enhance their education in the construction industry, with an emphasis on federal contracting requirements.

Our Colorado Springs and Greenwood Village offices are seeking Interns to provide construction administration support. Typical projects include a wide variety of Federal projects, including storm water, concrete and asphalt paving, utilities, commercial buildings and related ancillary facilities.

Your Role:

* Observing and /or interacting with various professionals related to the construction field including owners, architects, subcontractors and vendors.
* Attending staff or departmental meetings on an ongoing basis and any appropriate project-specific or coordination meetings.
* Review of Safety job hazard analysis/OSHA training/SDS/STA/safety audits.
* Learning and participating in the Quality Control process, including punchlist, QC checklist, testing and inspection requirements, inspection reports, etc.
* Administrative Support, including review and assist project team with development and tracking of RFIs/submittals/material ordering and tracking.
* Completing, updating and distributing project management communications of various types such as purchase orders, safety inspections, material and labor logs, and meeting agendas/ minutes.
* Schedule - production reporting/trend charts/manpower tracking/SIPS.
* Logistics - develop skills for use of project management software such as Procore and Blue Beam.
* Planning and coordination activities.
* Further education by observing and participating in all phases of construction; improve ability to read and interpret plans and specifications.
* Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications for an Intern:

* High School diploma or equivalent required.
* Completed one (1) academic year of college (24 semester credits or 36 quarterly credits) prior to internship start date.
* Must be a current enrolled student earning a degree with an accredited college/university and/or graduate student enrolled in an accredited college/university post-graduate studies program.
* Ability to operate MS Office at an intermediate level.
* Positive approach to learning and the ability to take direction from various sources in different formats.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to successfully pass and remain in compliance with required background checks from Tribal 1 and any required federal government background checks.
* Individual must be either a citizen of the U.S. or a non-U.S. citizen who has been lawfully admitted for permanent residence as evidenced by a Permanent Resident Card (USCIS I-551).
* Must pass drug screen and remain in compliance with drug free workplace policies.
* Valid driver's license.

Are you attentive to detail? Do you have good verbal and written communication skills? Can you balance multiple tasks while demonstrating good time management? Are you reliable and responsible? Do you have problem-solving abilities? If yes, you might just be perfect for this intern position!

**ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?**

title: Cybersecurity Intern
description:
**JOB SUMMARY:**

ZIVARO provides industry-leading consulting and technology services to help secure our client’s organizations. ZIVARO has delivered successful security outcomes for the government, military, financial services, healthcare, and commercial organizations for more than 20 years. 

 

**This position is a paid internship.** ZIVARO is currently seeking a qualified Cybersecurity intern for our Solutions & Engineering Services team. This is a paid opportunity available in Denver or Remotely. Interested candidates should have a firm career path in Cybersecurity, Engineering, or Information Systems, with solid academic training in one or more of the respective disciplines. The summer internship program at ZIVARO will include a comprehensive curriculum consisting of AWS Cloud Security, Governance & Compliance, Risk Assessments, Vulnerability Management, and assistance with security tools. 

**POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Interest in Cybersecurity, and desire to learn more.
* Review and update documentation for policies, procedures, standards, and guidelines.
* Understanding AWS Cloud Security and the security services used.
* Validating security compliance, researching vulnerabilities and security risk, reviewing security risk assessments, and providing audit support.
* Assist with vulnerability and compliance assessments.
* Assistance with tools and analysis of output.
* Understanding of NIST compliance and corresponding security controls.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Willingness to share ideas and improve processes.
* Currently enrolled or recently graduated in any of the following majors: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, IT, Information Systems, Engineering,

**QUALIFICATIONS:** 

ZIVARO is looking for a person who is currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program or recent graduate. Ideally, this person is organized, has a strong work ethic, and is technologically- minded. This person must have the ability to work as a member of the team, strong communication with internal and external stakeholders and have a proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment. In addition, this person would have a positive attitude, excellent verbal and written communication skills, and technical curiosity. If you are willing to exceed expectations and have a good attitude- this role may be for you! 

**U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions at Zivaro, due to security clearance and government/federal contracts held by Zivaro.** 

EEO STATEMENT 

*ZIVARO fully subscribes to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity. It is our policy to provide employment, compensation and other benefits related to employment based on qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. In accordance with requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act, it is our policy to provide reasonable accommodation upon request during the application process to eligible applicants in order that they may be given a full and fair opportunity to be considered for employment. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we intend to comply fully with applicable federal and state employment laws and the information requested on this application will only be used for purposes consistent with those laws.*

title: Intern- Catering Sales @ Colorado Convention Center
description:
**Job Listing: Intern- Catering Sales** 

Are you ready to put your education in to action with on-the-job experience? 

The Sodexo Live! Intern Program offers an exciting opportunity for currently enrolled college students to turn their leadership potential into valuable professional experience and get a head start on their careers.

**Sodexo Live Information:**

At Sodexo Live!, we take pride in crafting exceptional events at the most prestigious venues on the planet and creating lasting memories for fans, visitors, guests and team members. Working with Sodexo Live! is more than a job; it's a chance to be part of something greater. Here, you'll build a career where 'everyday' is anything but normal.

Our experiences are unique, and so are our people. Bring your personality, your background and your desire to delight others. In return, we'll give you all you need to thrive. After giving it all, you'll return home knowing that you've played your part in creating a truly unforgettable moment.

* 2022 Forbes Best Employer for Diversity
* 2022 Front Office Sports Best Employers in Sports
* 2022 Disability Equality Index (DEI) Perfect Score

**Location**: We are seeking an experienced **Intern- Catering Sales** for the **C****olorado Convention Center** 

Opened in 1990, with more than 100 professional meeting planners working together with architects to design every aspect of the building, the result was simple; a sensible, state-of-the-art facility with easy traffic flow and everything you need in a stunningly beautiful building in the heart of downtown Denver. Expanded in 2005, well-known as one of the most practical and "user friendly" meeting facilities, the Colorado Convention Center is now home to over 250+ events annually. The Colorado Convention Center is located within easy walking distance of over 8,400 hotel rooms, 300 restaurants, 9 theaters of the Denver Performing Arts Complex and a wide variety of shopping and retail outlets.

**Why Should I Apply?**

* Gain valuable industry experience working with leaders in the hospitality field
* Flexible scheduling options that are accommodating to the student's school schedule
* Professional development
* Mentoring from a Sodexo Live! Manager

**Principal Function:**

The Intern- Catering Sales will help develop and execute sales strategy for Sodexo Live! across our portfolio of venues with catering and quick serve service offerings. The intern will directly assist the management team of sales related functions, including communicating with staff on a daily basis, creating effective new business techniques and maintaining customer service with current clients. The Senior Catering Sales Manager is responsible for creating unique dining experiences by directing, selling, up-selling and actively participating in the planning and production of catered functions. Working closely with clients, as well as with the sales, culinary and operations staff, they are responsible for ensuring that events are coordinated and executed smoothly and in accordance with all client expectations and specifications.

The Intern will support the planning of and preparation for events according to anticipated attendance and will provide hands-on management and oversight in the areas of service and F&B operations during events. 

**Essential Responsibilities:**

* Maximize Sodexo Live!'s catering revenue through creative sales techniques and customer focus.
* Contribute to the efficient operation of business unit by reconciling data and providing information, insight, analysis, and recommendations to maximize revenues and profits.
* Contribute to goal of making Sodexo Live! #1 in Event Hospitality and the #1 Employer of Choice through personal commitment and leading by example.

**Qualifications/Skills:**

* Current college student with studies in hospitality/food management, communications, human resources, accounting, marketing or another industry-related college program.
* Ability to multi-task and prioritize and work successfully both independently and as part of a team.
* Excellent customer service skills.
* Exceptional ability to communicate effectively in both verbal and written formats.
* Keen ability to connect easily with others and create positive positioning within a particular context or subject matter.
* Demonstrated success in interfacing with a variety of organizational functions and divisions to accomplish tasks.

**Other Requirements**:

* Able to work effectively and safely while subject to wet floors, temperature extremes and excessive noise; must be able to lift up to 50 pounds in weight; must be able to maneuver in an often tightly-quartered environment.

Hours may be extended or irregular to include nights, weekends and holidays.

Thank you for expressing interest in employment with Sodexo Live!. While only those candidates considered for this position will be contacted, your resume will remain on file for 90 days.

*Sodexo Live! is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, genetic information, status as a protected veteran or status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable Federal, State or Local law.*

  
  
***Job Posted by ApplicantPro***

title: Field Intern - Water Resources
description:
**Position:** Environmental Services / Water Resources Intern (Seasonal position)  
**Industry:** Environmental Consulting & Engineering  
**Location:** Westminster, CO  
**Compensation:** $20 per hour  
  
**About Us:** Join Apex, a dynamic environmental consulting & engineering firm dedicated to growth and professional development. We're seeking motivated individuals who are eager to learn and contribute to our team.  
  
**Your Role as a Field Intern:**

* Gain hands-on experience in construction skills, environmental compliance, and safety protocols.
* Work on active construction sites and urban landscapes.
* Perform general landscaping tasks to restore areas to pre-construction conditions, including sodding, irrigation, and hardscaping.
* Assist in construction site sediment discharge maintenance/cleanup.
* Prepare written field reports and communicate effectively with supervisors.
* Use hand tools and demonstrate the ability to lift and carry 50 pounds.
* Prioritize safety and adhere to safe work practices.

**Why You'll Love Working With Us:*** Gain experience and exposure to a growing environmental consulting firm.
* Collaborate with and learn from industry experts.
* Join a nationally recognized firm with over 1,200 employees and 50+ locations across the US.

**What We're Looking For:*** 0-2 years of experience; newcomers are welcome.
* Light construction experience such as masonry or landscaping is advantageous.
* Basic understanding of environmental science and regulatory knowledge.
* Strong verbal communication skills and the ability to multitask.
* Excellent record-keeping abilities.
* Possession of a valid driver's license and a clean driving record.
* Ability to pass a pre-employment background check and drug test.
* Access to reliable transportation.

  
Apex Companies, LLC is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug Free Workplace.

title: Human Resources Engagement Intern
description:
**Human Resources Engagement Intern**

**Denver, CO** 

  
Rocky Mountain Public Media, Inc. (RMPM) is the parent company of Rocky Mountain PBS, KUVO Jazz and THE DROP 104.7. Over a million Coloradans turn to Rocky Mountain PBS, KUVO Jazz and THE DROP 104.7 to discover provocative and inspiring local, national and international programming; find diverse viewpoints; score front row center seats to world-class performances; and experience lifelong learning opportunities every month.

  
The Human Resources Engagement Intern helps RMPM to create and foster an organizational environment that values inclusion, development, diversity and growth for all employees. The HR Engagement Intern will be honed in on RMPM's culture and seeks to continuously improve the employee experience in response to their input. The HR Engagement Intern will be instrumental in the furthering of organization-wide programs, strategies, and goals as they relate to our people, culture, and business. The ideal candidate for this role is reliable, organized, forward-thinking, and committed to the ever-evolving world of HR.

  
This internship position will start with a small cohort of fellow interns on June 3, 2024. Selected candidates may expect to work anywhere from 10-12 weeks, depending on their class schedule. This internship opportunity offers 15-20 hours of work per week depending on class schedule.

  
**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

  
* 
Coordinate and plan summer open enrollment/HR Benefits Fair

* 
Curate Monthly HR Newsletter 

* 
Collect, interpret, and report on Summer Employee Engagement Survey results

* 
Support HR events such as quarterly new hire lunches, engagement survey incentive activities, quarterly DEI training, and all staff strategy days.

* 
Assist with recruiting activities, including but are not limited to creating and posting jobs, conducting reference checks, and drafting offer letters

* 
Create and maintain various training materials, standard work documents, process & user guides where needed

* 
Assist in updating, importing, reporting, and exporting data into our various systems

* 
Assist with curating and posting company content for employees using SharePoint (company intranet)

* 
Plan engagement activities for summer intern cohort, such as lunch and learns, mixers, and more

* 
Respond to various HR inquiries and direct to appropriate channels

* 
Develop and propose one engagement initiative that RMPM should consider implementing in the future

* 
Attend weekly HR Department meetings

* 
Actively participate in RMPM's Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) program

* 
Other tasks as assigned and/or required.


  
  


**Minimum Qualifications of Position**

* 
High school degree or equivalent

* 
Must be currently enrolled in, or have recently graduated from, a program at an accredited college, university, or technical school

* 
A mix of demonstrated skills, abilities and knowledge will be considered in place of education requirements

* 
Familiarity with Microsoft Office, Excel, Adobe, Canva, or equivalent system(s)

* 
Demonstrated awareness of global and cultural issues; ability to understand multiple cultural and community perspectives.

* 
Basic knowledge or interest in HR practices in areas such as employment law, regulatory compliance, employee relations, ADA preferred 

* Utilizes multiple perspectives to ensure all staff feel valued, and inclusive and equitable practices are embedded in the organizational culture at large.

**ADDITIONAL Qualifications of Position**

* 
Must be able to work both independently and as a collaborative and productive team member.

* 
Must possess strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work professionally and productively with persons at all levels.

* 
Must possess exceptional time management, decision making and organizational skills.

* 
Must be detail-oriented with an ability to manage several projects simultaneously.

* 
Must have a demonstrated ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines, and work within established budgets and guidelines.


  
**Work Environment**

This position works primarily in office, studio, editing, and/or field environments. This position must be able to work a flexible schedule with occasionally long hours including some evenings and weekends. Must be able to travel throughout the state and beyond, on occasion. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  
**Physical Demands**

The position requires the ability to lift and carry production equipment up to 50 lbs. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  
**EEO Statement**

Rocky Mountain Public Media embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. As such, Rocky Mountain Public Media does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Summer Sales Intern
description:
**Company description:**

The Aruza Marketing Internship provides individuals the opportunity to learn vital skills in sales, persuasion, work ethic, and professional communication. Upon completion of the internship you will be able to bolster your resume with experiences and tangible numbers you’ve produced over the summer as well as demonstrate the skills you’ve learned when step into your careers. Get a jumpstart in your future careers today!

**What Aruza is looking for:**

* Sell door-to-door pest control services to prospective customers
* Experience in outside sales or client service environment (Preferred)
* Passion for people and outstanding customer service skills
* Demonstrated persuasion and negotiation skills
* Goal-oriented with a focus on achieving sales success

**As a first year rep, you will utilize your strengths and our company training to:**

* Sell door-to-door pest control services to prospective customers
* Work a minimum of 40 hours a week and willing to work during holidays
* Provide excellent customer service to client base and handle objections effectively
* Master sales techniques and improve communication skills, leadership qualities, and time management

**How Aruza compensates your work:**

* Sales positions have a tiered commission structure.
* Average entry level representatives average $12,000 - $20,000 in a summer (12 weeks), while top entry level representatives earn upwards of $30,000+ in a summer (12 weeks).
* Free rent for qualified candidates who meet a specific sales target.
* All-inclusive company trips to exotic places outside the country.
* Performance based promotion and ability to earn partner status in the fastest growing pest control company.

**The Why:**

The culture, the nation-leading training, the teams, the leadership, the skillset, the pay, and the experience gained are unbeatable and incomparable. Earn more money, learn better skills, grow more than anywhere else, and experience an awesome culture---find out what makes Aruza the top internship and job for college students.

Empower yourself to graduate debt free. Learn the skills to start your own business. Show the leadership to quickly move into management in future jobs.

title: Intern, Growth Marketing
description:
Job Description:

We’re searching for a passionate and creative Growth Marketing intern to support our expanding social media & growth marketing team. In this role, you’ll assist with day-to-day needs across a variety of projects and help us push forward best-in-class creative work.

Who You Are:

* Enjoy copywriting, have a strong eye for design, and can craft a unique and fun brand story
* A clean aesthetic, and a sharp eye for layout, color, and typography
* Impeccable communication skills, exceptional organizational and time management skills, and the ability to keep yourself accountable and productive in a flexible work environment
* Actively use and are deeply familiar with social media platforms including but not limited to Facebook, Pinterest, Instagram, YouTube, and LinkedIn
* Deep interest in contemporary and luxury brands (especially travel), with a finger on the pulse of what’s trending
* Have an eye for great content and understand photo composition (familiarity with photo editing/design tools like Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign), Canva, or similar preferred)
* Familiarity with the Microsoft Office Suite including Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint

What You Will Do:

* **Able to work 15-20 hours per week with time in our Denver office**
* Develop content strategy, themes, and ideas monthly across social media channels
* Contribute to content curation through copywriting and image selection
* Play an integral role in the launch of new projects on Facebook and Instagram and stay up to date on current travel trends on social media
* Keep an eye on partner social media channels for relevant content we can reshare
* Stay up to date on current industry trends/news and flag stories that Exclusive Resorts could fit into
* Stay on top of annual holidays and events in our destinations so we can support on social media

title: Intern-Nuggets Ticket  Sales
description:
**Job Title:** NuggetsTicket Sales Intern

**Department:**Ticket Sales

**Business Unit**: KSE 

**Location:** Denver, CO

**Reports To:** Manager, Inside Sales

**Employment Type**: Part-Time/20-29 Hours/Week–Hourly–Non-Exempt

**Supervisor Position:** No

**\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_**

Kroenke Sports & Entertainment (KSE) is an American Sports and Entertainment holding company based in Denver, Colorado. KSE is committed to providing world class sports and entertainment for both live and broadcast audiences. We are the employer of choice as the owner and operator of Ball Arena, DICK’S Sporting Goods Park, the Paramount Theatre, 1STBANK Center, Denver Nuggets (NBA), the Colorado Avalanche (NHL), Colorado Mammoth (NLL), Colorado Rapids (MLS), KIMN,KXKL, KKSE (FM/AM), Altitude Sports & Entertainment, Major League Fishing/Fishing League Worldwide (MLFLW), Winnercomm, Outdoor Sportsman Group and SkyCam. 

**Nature of Work:**

The Nuggets Ticket Sales Intern will assist the ticket sales department in executing various projects for the Denver, Nuggets, Colorado Avalanche, Colorado Mammoth and Colorado Rapids. Projects include but aren’t limited to: ticket sales reporting, giveaways, creative updates and office management. The Ticket Sales Intern will also assist with planning prospect events, and other various projects to prepare for and execute during the 2023-2024 regular seasons.

 

 

**Examples of work performed:**

* Managing a check-in table for a ticket sales prospecting event
* Organizing and taking inventory of team giveaways
* Creating ticket voucher and fliers for upcoming sales events
* Sending out prospect tickets to an upcoming game
* Attending ticket sales events to assist with giveaway items, as well as assist in set-up and tear-down if necessary
* Assist with office management and organization

 

**This description is a summary only and is describing the general level of work being performed, it is not intended to be all-inclusive. The duties of this position may change from time to time and/or based on business needs. We reserve the right to add or delete duties and responsibilities at the discretion of the supervisor and/or hiring authority.** 

**Working Conditions & Physical Demands:**

* Typical Office Conditions
* Ability to work remotely
* Lift up to 50 lbs. occasionally
* Occasionally work outdoors in extreme weather conditions

**Qualifications**

· Minimum

o High School or GED

o Currently pursuing a college degree

o Applicants must meet minimum qualifications at the time of hire.

· Preferred

o None

 

**Competencies/Knowledge,** Skills & Abilities

* Ability to maintain positive attitude and demonstrate a strong professional presence
* Ability to complete work accurately and in a timely manner
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple departments
* Willingness to learn and contribute to team goals
* Availability to work some nights and weekends
* Ability to acquire or produce and maintain a valid Colorado driver’s license and meet company vehicle driving standards preferred

 

**Compensation**

* Base hourly $18.29 per hour

 

**Benefits Include**

* 401K plan

 

*All applicants for employment at KSE may be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to commencing employment. Applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment may be required to produce proof of vaccination status prior to their first day of employment. Applicants with qualifying disabilities or bona fide religious objections, or who are pregnant, may be exempted from this requirement or otherwise accommodated if they are unable to be vaccinated.*

**Equal Employment Opportunity**

*Kroenke Sports & Entertainment (KSE) provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.*
