Software Quality Engineer Intern: Summer 2024
description:
**Software Quality Engineer Internship** 

Applied Concepts, Inc.

*Richardson, Texas*

  
**Software Quality Engineer Intern - Job Overview:** 

Applied Concepts has been known for its exceptional law enforcement Radar & Lidar systems for over 47 years. We're based in Richardson, TX, less than 3 miles from the UTD campus. We're taking big steps to transition over to cloud-based platforms and our team is looking for motivated Software Quality Engineer interns to join us for Spring 2024 and beyond.

We are looking for two part-time interns (with flexible start dates); hours per week will be project-based but are negotiable in advance. This internship requires availability for scheduled onsite meetings and access to various test systems. Note: Several of our previous interns have opted to work with us through the rest of their education and beyond, so we offer both official internships for class credits and continuing work opportunities.

***The compensation for this internship is $20-$30 per hour, based on skill set and education level. (No relocation assistance is possible for out-of-area candidates).*** 

  
**Software Quality Engineer Intern - How You'll Make an Impact:**

As a Software Quality Engineer, you will be responsible for performing integration testing and end-to-end testing, including functionality and quality of software products created by the company. You will also collaborate with other developers, architects, and stakeholders to ensure that the solutions meet business requirements and adhere to the best practices and standards.

  
**Software Quality Engineer Intern - Qualifications:**

* Pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field.
* Familiar with common software quality assurance methodologies, tools, and processes.
* Proficient in at least one programming language, such as C# & Python.
* Familiar with writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases.
* Familiar with working in an Agile/Scrum development process.
* Good problem-solving, and teamwork skills. Ability to work in a team as well as an individual.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Excellent time-management skills and commitment to meet deadlines.

**Added bonus if you have:**

* Prior work experience in software development or software QA.
* JavaScript and/or HTML programming skills

  
**Software Quality Engineer Intern - What You'll Be Doing:**

* Collaborate with the Web and Applications team, as well as the Traffic Products team, to develop test plans and execute test cases that are designed to expose software, firmware, and hardware defects across a spectrum of use-cases.
* Develop semi-automated test systems which can be used to efficiently execute regression testing for new product releases.
* Assist the QA team with system testing and assist the development teams with fault isolation and debugging.

  
**Software Quality Engineer Intern - What You'll Gain:**

* Career-building project experience.
* Competitive compensation.
* Rewards and recognition programs.
* Learning and development opportunities.
* Code reviews and mentoring from industry experts.
* Convenient office location.
* Excellent work/life balance.
* Great culture and collaborative environment.
* Join our recently-launched ACI Young Professionals group (YoPro) for professional development, social activities, and leadership opportunities.

  
**Who We Are:**

Applied Concepts is a 47-year-old, 200-person privately owned company, located in Richardson, Texas. Founded in 1977 by an electrical engineer, we have a long history of profitable, organic growth. Our company remains entrepreneurial at heart, constantly re-inventing ourselves with new products and new markets, but still balanced with business prudence. We manufacture our own products, in our own facilities. Integrating our product development with our own manufacturing resources is a key part of our business culture, keeping us nimble and able to provide high quality products.

  
**What We Do:**

We focus on designing, manufacturing, and selling products that promote public safety. We are the number one supplier of speed enforcement products to law enforcement in the United States. Our employees take pride in the quality of our products and the service we provide in keeping our streets and neighborhoods safe. We offer a variety of engineering challenges, from microwave to high-speed lasers, to image capturing and processing, and LED traffic calming devices.

  
To learn more about us and explore career opportunities, please visit www.stalkerradar.com

  
*Only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. We use E-Verify to confirm eligibility for all new hires.*

title: Summer Intern
description:
**Join TriumphX!**

TriumphX provides a concentration of technology and project management resources the members of the Triumph Financial portfolio of brands – TriumphPay, Triumph and TBK Bank – via a shared service model. We’re looking for top tech and project management talent to analyze, recommend and build strategic solutions that support Triumph Financial’s mission to become a world-class, market-leading financial and technology company.

At Triumph Financial, we are a purpose-driven financial services company focused on creating value by helping our team members thrive, our customers succeed, and our communities prosper. When we do this, we are “Helping People Triumph.”

Our paid internship program enables students to participate in valuable real-world experience through a variety of tailored assignments within their areas of interest and fields of study. Students will also be given an opportunity to partner with other interns to explore other areas of the organization and learn from a diverse group of Executive Leaders throughout the program. Learning opportunities will be provided throughout the summer to equip you with essential skills you can take with you to apply throughout your career.

**Opportunity**

Currently, we have the following internships available:

* IT > Project Management
* IT > Information Security
* IT> Data analyst or Data Engineer

***This is a 9-week program running from June 10, 2024 – August 9, 2024.***

**Responsibilities**

As an intern, you will….

* If chosen for the project management route help determine the capacity of our infrastructure allow us to determine the demand that our system can handle today so we can focus on improvements for the future.
* If chosen for the information security route work on scripting automation processes to handle data from our different applications in a secure manner.
* Regardless of route you will be responsible for working well along side our current team members and learning as much as you can from them.
* Make the most of the career development events you will participate in this summer.

***​***

**Position Qualifications**

* 1--2 years of relevant work experience
* Currently pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s degree in one of the following degree programs: Computer science, cyber security, management information systems, information security or another related field.
* You are graduating from an under grad or graduate program between Dec 2024 and Aug 2025
* Must be willing to work at our onsite company headquarters (Dallas, Texas) full-time.
* Strong technical, logical, analytical, and critical thinking skills
* High levels of commitment and initiative
* Proficient in Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Access, and Outlook

**Physical Requirements**

* Must be able to perform essential duties satisfactorily with reasonable accommodations.
* Work is generally done sitting, talking, hearing, and typing. Visual acuity to use a keyboard, prepare and analyze data and figures; transcribing, viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading.

​

**Work Environment**

* Work is regularly performed in a combination of office and conference settings and routinely uses standard office equipment.
* Travel Required: Occasional 0-10% to local offices in the DFW area.

**Compensation** 

* $21 per hour

#LI-KF1

**We offer Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Time Off, 401k and much more.**

Go on. Do it. Apply Today!

title: Communications Intern (Spring Semester, Part Time)
description:
**We’d love to hear from you if you like:**

* 
Start-up energy - come join one of LinkedIn’s Top 50 Tech Start-ups

* 
Learning and solving interesting problems in a huge market ($2T market size)

* 
Working closely with serial entrepreneurs and strong leaders who have scaled companies like Amazon, Facebook, Alibaba, Robinhood, Sofi, Microsoft, etc.

* 
Meritocracy - we promote based on performance, not tenure


**About the internship:**

We’re hiring a part-time spring semester Communications Intern to join our team! You’ll work closely with our Communications team to build awareness and reputation for the Jerry brand, primarily through media relations and data journalism. If you thrive in fast-paced remote work environments and desire to experience working at a start-up, this may be the role for you. This is a part-time, paid, remote internship, starting in January 2024 or earliest available.

**How you will make an impact:**

* 
Supporting day-to-day media relations outreach efforts across consumer, tech, business and trade media

* 
Monitoring, tracking and reporting results

* 
Daily trendspotting societal and cultural news

* 
Brainstorming and developing targeted media pitches

* 
Conducting media research, developing media audits and targeted media lists

* 
Monitoring for general news and competitor news, flagging opportunities/threats

* 
Assisting in social media research and video script writing

* 
Potential to assist in social media video content creation for TikTok, Instagram and Threads

* 
Supporting with internal communications

* 
Research ideas for data journalism studies

* 
Developing data journalism study content with mentorship and support from our data journalist


**Ideal Candidate:** 

* 
You’re obsessed with news and following pop culture, societal conversation, and trends (you’re a news junkie!)

* 
You are a journalism major or minor, or have previous media relations or communications internship experience or similar

* 
You have superior writing and editing skills with the ability to – you can take complex, nuanced topics and develop creative, compelling, clear, concise and crisp pitches, stories and headlines

* 
You’re a multitasker who can juggle multiple projects and deadlines, manage competing projects and urgent deliverables without missing a beat, and a pillar of composure under pressure

* 
You thrive in fast-paced environments and are interested in gaining in-house, start-up experience

* 
You are scrappy, resourceful and proactively uncover solutions to keep moving projects forward


*Jerry is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, reproductive health decisions or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or other characteristics protected by applicable local, state or federal laws.* 

*Jerry is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at* *recruiting@getjerry.com*

**About Jerry:**

Jerry is America’s first and only AllCar™ app. We are redefining and radically improving how people manage owning a car, one of their most expensive and time-consuming assets. 

Backed by artificial intelligence and machine learning, Jerry simplifies and automates owning and maintaining a car while providing personalized services for all car owners' needs. We spend every day innovating and improving our AI-powered app to provide the best possible experience for our customers. From car insurance and financing to maintenance and safety, Jerry does it all.

We are the #1 rated and most downloaded app in our category with a 4.7 star rating in the App Store. We have more than 4 million customers — and we’re just getting started. 

Jerry was founded in 2017 by serial entrepreneurs and has raised more than $242 million in financing.

Join our team and work with passionate, curious and egoless people who love solving real-world problems. Help us build a revolutionary product that’s disrupting a massive market.

title: Summer Sales Intern
description:
**Company description:**

The Aruza Marketing Internship provides individuals the opportunity to learn vital skills in sales, persuasion, work ethic, and professional communication. Upon completion of the internship you will be able to bolster your resume with experiences and tangible numbers you’ve produced over the summer as well as demonstrate the skills you’ve learned when step into your careers. Get a jumpstart in your future careers today!

**What Aruza is looking for:**

* Sell door-to-door pest control services to prospective customers
* Experience in outside sales or client service environment (Preferred)
* Passion for people and outstanding customer service skills
* Demonstrated persuasion and negotiation skills
* Goal-oriented with a focus on achieving sales success

**As a first year rep, you will utilize your strengths and our company training to:**

* Sell door-to-door pest control services to prospective customers
* Work a minimum of 40 hours a week and willing to work during holidays
* Provide excellent customer service to client base and handle objections effectively
* Master sales techniques and improve communication skills, leadership qualities, and time management

**How Aruza compensates your work:**

* Sales positions have a tiered commission structure.
* Average entry level representatives average $12,000 - $20,000 in a summer (12 weeks), while top entry level representatives earn upwards of $30,000+ in a summer (12 weeks).
* Free rent for qualified candidates who meet a specific sales target.
* All-inclusive company trips to exotic places outside the country.
* Performance based promotion and ability to earn partner status in the fastest growing pest control company.

**The Why:**

The culture, the nation-leading training, the teams, the leadership, the skillset, the pay, and the experience gained are unbeatable and incomparable. Earn more money, learn better skills, grow more than anywhere else, and experience an awesome culture---find out what makes Aruza the top internship and job for college students.

Empower yourself to graduate debt free. Learn the skills to start your own business. Show the leadership to quickly move into management in future jobs.

title: IT Intern
description:
Description:**Performance Objectives:**

The IT intern will assist our IT department with the goal of learning what the IT profession in homebuilding entails. 

**The IT Intern will be responsible for:** 

· Assisting IT staff with upcoming projects

· Computer maintenance 

· Assist with software installation and updates: help install and update software on company computers and devices.

· Provide technical support: respond to help desk tickets and assist employees with technical issues. 

· Conduct research: Research new technologies and tools that could benefit the company.

· Assist with network maintenance: Help maintain the company’s network infrastructure, including switches, routers, and firewalls. 

· Assist with data backup and recovery: Help ensure that company data is backed up and can be recovered in the event of a disaster. 

· Assist with cybersecurity: Help ensure that the company's systems and data are secure from cyber threats.

· Assist with website maintenance: Help maintain the company's website, including updating content and troubleshooting issues.

· Assist with database management: Help manage the company's databases, including backing up data and ensuring data integrity.

· Ability to communicate with management and employees. 

· Ability to organize information to avoid missing details. 

· Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.

· Ability to learn software programs. 

· Ability to multitask.

title: Accounting & Consulting Intern
description:
**Accounting & Consulting Intern**

Are you regularly described as being a perfectionist? Are you a self-starter and prefer work to socializing? Are you the one everyone turns to when a software application quits working? Do you enjoy figuring out new software features as soon as upgrades are published?

Do you like helping others in the class or in the office reduce the number of steps it takes to get something done with mission-critical apps?

BTerrell Group seeks individuals currently in business school or with business and accounting experience to help us support our clients in the selection, implementation and use of Sage Intacct, the preferred provider of cloud-based accounting software according to the AICPA. We help client companies do more back-office work without applying more resources. Our application consultants think like this:

**Who You Are:**

* 
I see ways of doing things that others do not see.

* 
I enjoy a high-paced, always changing, customer facing, problem solving role.

* 
Finding and establishing the most effective system or process to accomplish an accounting or business task excites me.

* 
I can easily imagine multiple ways to get the job done.

* 
I enjoy details and facts.

* 
I look forward to program upgrades, install them quickly, and try them out.

* 
I adopt new technology early.

* 
I enjoy leading others to the most effective way of using accounting technology.

* 
If I am not the first person with the best idea this time, I try to figure how I can be the next time. [I want to be the first person with the best idea, and, if not, I want to learn what it takes to be so.]

* 
I want to be the first person to suggest the best way to do something.

* 
I get joy from helping others do more work with less effort.


BTerrell Group, a business advisor and cloud-based accounting automation systems provider based in Dallas, seeks individuals with business and accounting interests and/or experience to guide clients in the selection, implementation and use of state of the art, cloud-based accounting software systems.

**Responsibilities**

Starting as an Accounting Software Consulting Intern at BTerrell, you will be exposed to basic accounting procedures and principles ranging from accounts payable and receivable systems to general ledger entries, to financial statement preparation, and analysis. These basic accounting skills will enable you to help implement Sage Intacct accounting software and automate our client’s accounting functions.

BTerrell accounting software consultants excel in these accounting automation implementation, support and presentation responsibilities:

**Implementation**

* 
Assist BTerrell Consultants in implementing Sage Intacct accounting software for new clients

* 
Implement Electronic Funds Transfer capabilities at new clients.

* 
Research, identify and fix Customer issues within EFT Manager and Sage Intacct

* 
Extract, transform and load data from existing data sources to Sage Intacct

* 
Prepare and manage a testing environment to train clients and test configuration choices prior to go-live

* 
Interpret and present technical instructions from a variety of resources to new users

* 
Assist and educate client during the first days and weeks of their use of Sage Intacct


**Support**

* 
Provide onsite and remote support to client company end users

* 
Research errors, resolve problems, and recommend configuration adjustments, if necessary

* 
Answer ongoing client processing and configuration questions

* 
Provide training to existing and new users

* 
Recommend Sage Intacct best practices

* 
Work closely with other Consultants to ensure Customer satisfaction and resolution of all open Accounting issues


**Report design and data manipulation**

* 
Design financial and operational reports using Sage Intacct reporting options

* 
Balance client expectations with software reporting capabilities

* 
Master the program tools for data integration between key business applications


**Product presentation and sales assistance**

* 
Assist sales staff with solution presentations

* 
Identify and translate automation opportunities into un-utilized or under-utilized Sage Intacct functional capabilities

* 
Become familiar with best-in-class third-party applications that seamlessly integrate with Sage Intacct

* 
Share opportunities for additional automation software or services with client and BTerrell sales staff

* 
Solve problems, automate business processes, and improve the client user’s experience


**General qualifications**

* Majoring in Accounting is preferred
* Working towards a Bachelor’s or Master's degree
* Quick Learner
* Understanding of basic accounting functions and concepts in Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, General Ledger
* Fearless curiosity about accounting software, business automation and leading-edge technology

title: Sr. Network Security Engineer
description:
Description:

Join us at GoEngineer as a Senior Network Engineer! We're seeking someone who has expertise in network and cybersecurity practices, who can confidently navigate FortiGate, FortiManager, and other Fortinet tools.


In this role, you'll:

* Monitor and maintain our networks and firewalls day-to-day.
* Handle firewall policy changes and equipment provisioning through FortiManager.
* Keep our systems secure with timely security patch updates.
* Collaborate with teams to enhance our security posture and contribute to cyber defense efforts.
* Maintain thorough documentation for network security processes.
* Assist in reviewing and improving our infrastructure and security protocols.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to propose new projects and assess risks.
* Support internal audits and regulatory compliance efforts.
* Mentor fellow IT team members on network security matters.
* Ensure access controls are properly managed and documented.
* Stay updated on emerging threats and security solutions.
* Occasionally, be available for evening or weekend work for upgrades or emergencies.

  

EDUCATION & CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, engineering, business administration, or related field; or equivalent work experience.
* Preferred Certifications: Security and/or network-related certs such as FCP (Fortinet Certified Professional) / FCSS (Fortinet Certified Solution Specialist) highly desired. (May be required to obtain FCP for long-term employment)


KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

* 3+ years of demonstrable IT troubleshooting and problem-solving experience.
* 5+ years of experience with TCP/IP, IPSec, SSL-VPN, VLANs, Subnetting, DHCP, routing, fiber, and CAT6.
* 5+ years of experience implementing and managing firewalls and network intrusion systems, specifically Fortinet products.
* Knowledge of common security principles, concepts, and methods.
* 5+ years of combined work experience in networking/infrastructure/security.
* Experience with Active Directory, Windows desktop, and server operating systems.
* Experience in host-based security, malware prevention, data loss prevention, digital forensics, and security information/event management systems.
* Experience with cloud-based solutions such as Microsoft 365, AWS, and Azure.
* Experience in vulnerability management of on-premises, cloud, and SaaS-based systems.
* Additional concepts such as BGP, OSPF, ADVPN / DMVPN, LAGG, MCLAG, ARP, OSI Model, STP, SAML, RADIUS, NAC, LLDP, DHCP options, aggregate tunnels, SDWAN, packet inspection, etc. are highly desirable.


OTHER REQUIREMENTS (SKILLS, ABILITIES, CHARACTERISTICS):

* Effective oral and written communication skills.
* Strong project management aptitude.
* Detail-oriented with a sense of urgency.
* Ability to troubleshoot and problem-solve effectively.
* Excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
* Sound judgment and commitment to continual learning.
* Ability to work well within a team and independently.

  


Requirements:

EDUCATION & CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, engineering, business administration, or related field; or equivalent work experience.
* Preferred Certifications: Security and/or network-related certs such as FCP (Fortinet Certified Professional) / FCSS (Fortinet Certified Solution Specialist) highly desired. (May be required to obtain FCP for long-term employment)


KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

* 3+ years of demonstrable IT troubleshooting and problem-solving experience.
* 5+ years of experience with TCP/IP, IPSec, SSL-VPN, VLANs, Subnetting, DHCP, routing, fiber, and CAT6.
* 5+ years of experience implementing and managing firewalls and network intrusion systems, specifically Fortinet products.
* Knowledge of common security principles, concepts, and methods.
* 5+ years of combined work experience in networking/infrastructure/security.
* Experience with Active Directory, Windows desktop, and server operating systems.
* Experience in host-based security, malware prevention, data loss prevention, digital forensics, and security information/event management systems.
* Experience with cloud-based solutions such as Microsoft 365, AWS, and Azure.
* Experience in vulnerability management of on-premises, cloud, and SaaS-based systems.
* Additional concepts such as BGP, OSPF, ADVPN / DMVPN, LAGG, MCLAG, ARP, OSI Model, STP, SAML, RADIUS, NAC, LLDP, DHCP options, aggregate tunnels, SDWAN, packet inspection, etc. are highly desirable.


OTHER REQUIREMENTS (SKILLS, ABILITIES, CHARACTERISTICS):

* Effective oral and written communication skills.
* Strong project management aptitude.
* Detail-oriented with a sense of urgency.
* Ability to troubleshoot and problem-solve effectively.
* Excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
* Sound judgment and commitment to continual learning.
* Ability to work well within a team and independently.

 **Position Hours & Location:**


This is a position that can be hybrid or in-office (Salt Lake City, UT or Pleasant Ridge, MI), full-time, Monday – Friday, 8:00am – 5:00pm.

**More about what GoEngineer offers:**


At GoEngineer, we understand that our value comes from our employees, and we celebrate and respect their unique experiences. We are working to build a culture where Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion practices are centered in the work we do, and employees feel welcomed as they are from the first day.

**Generous Benefits Include:**

* Participation in GoEngineer's generous PTO program from day one of employment.
* 401(k) Plan that includes up to a 6% company match, 100% vested day one.
* Choice of Traditional PPO or High Deductible Medical plans, and corresponding FSA or HSA accounts.
* Generous HSA Contribution with participation in the High Deductible Health Plan.
* Employer paid Life Insurance policy, optional Supplemental Life available.
* Employer paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Benefits.
* Dental, Vision, and other Ancillary benefits.

title: Information Security Analyst 2- Remote
company: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
description:
The Information Security Analyst 2 is an intermediate level, professional role that works as assigned with clear instruction and supervision from leaders to leverage designated tools and processes in the monitoring of systems and networks for unusual or abnormal activity of moderate scope. This position exercises judgement within defined procedures and practices to determine which potential incidents should be escalated through the appropriate channels for further investigation. The position also provides mentoring and training to less-experienced analysts.  



This individual works with divine guidance to provide or support technology that furthers the mission of the Church and reflects the eternal impact of the gospel.


  
* Review logs and reports to identify patterns that would indicate potential security incidents
* Identify abnormal circumstances, events, and event combinations for further review and investigation
* Assist in additional discovery and investigation under the direction of incident managers and higher-level analysts
* Mentor and train junior analysts
* Assist in the clarification and documentation of identified problems for future recognition and remediation
* General knowledge of information security practices, trends and technologies

  
Required:  



Education:


* Bachelor's degree or equivalent professional experience

Work Experience:


* 2 years of related experience in Information Security, IT and/or Computer Science, including expertise in one or more of the following areas: OS fundamentals, network fundamentals, security fundamentals, analysis skills, ISOC tools/processes, security essentials, SIEM
	+ These skillsets will be validated via an internal independent assessment (pass rate of 65%)
	+ Significant internship or work experience in security, privacy, business continuity, compliance or related area(s)

Demonstrated Skills & Abilities:


* Professional written and oral communication skills
* Detail-oriented with the proven ability to follow instructions
* Ability to successfully work in a team and mentor others
* Basic knowledge of IT organization patterns
* Basic knowledge of networking protocols and technologies
* Basic knowledge of information security tools, technologies, threats, and practices
* Basic knowledge of Windows and Linux operating systems, command line interfaces, and associated security concerns
* Basic knowledge of using a SIEM or data aggregation tool to analyze data sets and identify trends, anomalies, and actionable intelligence
* Ability to work effectively in a 24/7 environment

Desired Skills & Abilities:


* Understand how system storage and memory forensics are used in incident response
* Understand how cyber threat intelligence relates to incident response
* Demonstrated experience identifying attacks relating to application security, network security, and host security
* This job operates in a professional office environment
To successfully perform the essential functions of the job there may be physical requirements which need to be met such as sitting for long periods of time and using computer monitors/equipment  
* 

Preferred Qualifications:


* One or more of the following certifications preferred: Security+, Security Pro, GSEC, GCED, GCDA

  
Church employees find joy and satisfaction in using their unique talents and abilities to further the Lord’s work. From the IT professional who develops an app that sends the gospel message worldwide, to the facilities manager who maintains our buildings— giving Church members places to worship, teach, learn, and receive sacred ordinances—our employees seek innovative ways to share the gospel of Jesus Christ with the world. They are literally working in His kingdom.
Only members of the Church who are worthy of a temple recommend qualify for employment. Apart from this, the Church is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in its employment decisions on any basis that would violate U.S. or local law.
Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, national origin, color, gender, pregnancy, marital status, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or other legally protected categories that apply to the Church. The Church will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities.

title: Lead, Information Security Systems Engineer
description:
**Job Title:** Lead, Information Security Systems Engineer

**Job Location:** Salt Lake City-UT

**Job Code:** 8785

**Job Schedule:** 9/80, every other Friday off

 **L3Harris’ Communication Systems segment is currently seeking a Lead****, Information Security Systems Engineer** **to join our team.** This position will be based at our Salt Lake City-UT facility.

 **Position Overview:**


As a Lead, Information Security Systems Engineer at L3Harris Technologies, you will be involved in the cryptography that enables communication capabilities for the warfighter. We are looking for people with experience with cryptography design, development, and certification via FIPS 140 and/or NSA certification processes. Our team includes both experienced and developing engineers in the field of cryptography. We hope to find candidates who are ready to work on a deeply technical, high energy team.

 **Essential Responsibilities:**

* Understand and apply NSA and FIPS 140 requirements to cryptography products
* Work with both software and hardware design engineers to implement requirements that satisfy the certification standards
* Produce design and testing documentation to validate the implementation of the requirements
* Lead NSA certification and FIPS 140 validation development efforts
* Interface with internal and external customers to discuss design, implementation, and certification progress
* Able to adapt to change, focus on timeliness, and collaborate in joint decision-making processes is essential
* Ask questions and seek clarification on unfamiliar and/or unclear concepts, designs, and implementation details
* Travel up to 25% as needed

 **Basic Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s Degree and minimum 9 years of prior relevant experience. Graduate Degree and a minimum of 7 years of prior related experience. In lieu of a degree, minimum of 13 years of prior related experience.

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 4 years’ on-the-job experience related to cryptography design, implementation and/or certification or equivalent educational experience in the form of a cryptography based Master’s program.
* Possesses one of the following certifications at time of hire, or obtain one within 6 months of hire: Associate of CISSP, CISSP, CCNA Security, CSA+, GICSP, GSEC, Security+ CE, SSCP (DoD 8140/8570 qualified certifications)
* Able to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI security clearance
* Strong technical writing skills.
* Familiar with communications systems, computer networking concepts, protocols (including TCP/IP), and security methodologies
* Familiar with security engineering principles and processes
* Aware of basic security engineering design patterns, processes, and technologies
* Able to work in both group and individual settings under the direction, oversight, and mentoring of senior engineers
* Asks questions and seeks clarification on unfamiliar and/or unclear concepts, designs, and implementation details
* Strong problem-solving, creative thinking, and multi-tasking skills
* Familiar with RF communications
* Experience with matrixed development teams (hardware, software, systems engineers) and embedded systems engineering
* JCIDS, DJSIG, NIACAP, FIPS 140-2 or 140-3, NSA certification
* High assurance crypto systems
* Gov’t advisory/assistance as SETA/A&AS contractor in cybersecurity-related role
* Agile development processes
* Other security or technical certifications: CISA, CISM, CEH, CPT, MCSE, CCNA, Red Hat, Network+, SANS GIAC, Security+, CCNP Security, etc.
* Experience with TEMPEST, Anti-Tamper, or other system security specialties

  

#LI-CJ1

title: Agency Information, Privacy, & Security Director, DHHS
description:
**Agency Information, Privacy, & Security Director****Data, Systems & Evaluation**  

The **Utah Department of Health & Human Services** is looking for an **Agency Information Privacy & Security Director**, responsible for overseeing the agency information privacy and security program. Individuals are required to understand the data held by the department and the overarching federal code, federal regulations, state codes, state rules, contracts and other agreements that govern the data of the department.  

This position manages personnel and resources to guide the security and privacy aspects of system development, implementation, and upgrades; develops policies, procedures, and strategies for information security management and ensures the security of department data; work directly with agency leadership and IT partners to define and measure the execution of the privacy and security programs and facilitate reporting to all stakeholders; organizes and/or participates in privacy and security committees or work-groups; responds to and implements legislative actions regarding information privacy and security.  

The Agency Information Privacy and Security Director may require expertise of different privacy and security regulations, standards and frameworks, including but not limited to:* HIPAA,
* 42 CFR Part 2,
* IDEA,
* FERPA,
* IRS code,
* PCI compliance,
* NIST 800-53, and
* NIST Privacy Framework.

  

Responsible for the privacy and security budgets. Directly supervises Agency Information Security Manager(s), Agency Information Security Officers, other staff and provides complex technical assistance and/or training to others. **Preference**
May be required to have or obtain information privacy and security certifications and/or training. Approval from the Government Operations Privacy Officer is required for any agency to use this job. **Why You Should Join Our Team**


Become an integral part of the Utah Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) and contribute to the vision of advocating for, supporting, and serving all individuals and communities in Utah; and ensuring all Utahns have fair and equitable opportunities to live safe and healthy lives. Help us achieve this through effective policy and a seamless system of services and programs.

**The Agency**


For information on the Utah Department of Health & Human Services,

  

The **Utah Department of Health & Human Services** is looking for an **Agency Information Privacy & Security Director**, responsible for overseeing the agency information privacy and security program. Individuals are required to understand the data held by the department and the overarching federal code, federal regulations, state codes, state rules, contracts and other agreements that govern the data of the department.  

This position manages personnel and resources to guide the security and privacy aspects of system development, implementation, and upgrades; develops policies, procedures, and strategies for information security management and ensures the security of department data; work directly with agency leadership and IT partners to define and measure the execution of the privacy and security programs and facilitate reporting to all stakeholders; organizes and/or participates in privacy and security committees or work-groups; responds to and implements legislative actions regarding information privacy and security.  

The Agency Information Privacy and Security Director may require expertise of different privacy and security regulations, standards and frameworks, including but not limited to:* HIPAA,

Responsible for the privacy and security budgets. Directly supervises Agency Information Security Manager(s), Agency Information Security Officers, other staff and provides complex technical assistance and/or training to others. **Preference**
May be required to have or obtain information privacy and security certifications and/or training. Approval from the Government Operations Privacy Officer is required for any agency to use this job. **Why You Should Join Our Team**


Become an integral part of the Utah Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) and contribute to the vision of advocating for, supporting, and serving all individuals and communities in Utah; and ensuring all Utahns have fair and equitable opportunities to live safe and healthy lives. Help us achieve this through effective policy and a seamless system of services and programs.

 **The Agency**


For information on the Utah Department of Health & Human Services,


**Example of Duties**
---------------------


**EXAMPLES OF DUTIES:**

* Manages and organizes department information security posture.
* Evangelizes privacy and security principles within the department and continuously works to embed improvement of privacy and security practices within existing and new programs.
* Works with the Division of Technology Services in developing strategic IT plans, and improving security posture and compliance with federal and state security policies and standards.
* Conducts security risk assessments.
* Conducts privacy risk assessments.
* Develops, implements, and monitors department security policies, procedures, and/or standards.
* Anticipates the impact that new or modified software will have on existing standards and systems.
* Applies theoretical expertise and innovation to create decision support tools to improve security practices.
* Provides technical security assistance and consults with bureau/division/department directors.
* Organizes and/or participates in state-wide and/or agency-wide security committees and/or work-groups.
* Works with the Division of Technology Services to develop technical requirements, standards, and specifications to ensure and maintain systems security.
* Manages security systems, including workflow analysis, resources, contracts, personnel and system evaluation.
* Monitors and evaluates electronic operations, processes and practices for quality and effectiveness, and makes recommendations for improvement.
* Establishes goals, objectives, and priorities and assures adequate administrative controls, quality and procedural efficiencies.
* Acts as a resource to provide information or determine the most effective way of meeting the needs of management, staff, clients or customers.
* Analyzes, summarizes and/or reviews data; reports findings, interprets results and makes recommendations.
* Supervises subordinate personnel including: hiring, determining workload and delegating assignments, training, monitoring and evaluating performance.
* Develop strategies for the continuous improvement of the department's privacy and security posture and support enabling technologies and programs to achieve desired agency outcomes.
* Ensures each office in the department has risk assessments that are reviewed every three years
* Monitors budget, including revenues, expenditures and budget projection, etc.

**Typical Qualifications**
--------------------------


* The ability to communicate information and ideas so others will understand, including the ability to adapt communication.
* Fluency of Ideas - innovative and open-minded
* Collaborative with stakeholders
* The ability to come up with unusual or clever ideas about a given topic or situation, or to develop creative ways to solve a problem.
* The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong.
* Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.
* Determining how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes.
* Identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the system.
* The ability to get in the trenches with the teams to break through barriers and establish processes.
* Strong planning/project management skills.
* Results driven and ability to communicate.
* Motivating, developing, and directing people as they work, identifying the best people for the job.
* Knowledge of applications and programming.
* Knowledge of principles and methods for curriculum and training design, teaching and instruction for individuals and groups, and the measurement of training effects
* Knowledge of relevant equipment, policies, procedures, and strategies to promote effective local, state, or national security operations for the protection of people, data, property, and institutions.
  


**Supplemental Information**
----------------------------


* Risks found in typical office setting which is adequately lighted, heated and ventilated, e.g., safe use of office equipment, avoiding trips and falls, observing fire regulations, etc
* Typically, the employee may sit comfortably to perform the work; however there may be some walking, standing, bending, carrying light items, driving an automobile, etc. Special physical demands are not required to perform the work.
* This position is currently a hybrid of both in-office and remote work days. Please note, a position's eligibility for remote work is established by agency management and is subject to change at their discretion at any time and for any reason.

title: Security Analyst
description:
We are currently seeking an experienced Cybersecurity Professional with experience in Cybersecurity, Security Solution Architecture using SIEM, Security Penetration, Threat Exploitation, and Threat Mitigation. You will be joining a team of highly dedicated IT professionals that thrive for new challenges daily, as well as a company that demonstrates the greatest care for its employees and has a track record for sound business decisions.


**Description**
---------------


Location: Salt Lake City, UT  

  

Essential Job Functions:


* Developing Cybersecurity solutions for Network, Cloud, Gateway, and Endpoint security for Clients and the organization as a whole.
* Liaising with customer and internal teams and divisions to gather security requirements.
* Designing and implementing of specified security solutions within customer environments and the organization as a whole.
* Performing health checks on implemented security solutions within customer environments and the organization as a whole.
* Consulting with Clients and the organization on implementing security solutions based on SIEM practices.
* Consulting with Clients to provide them with Strategic Visioning for their future Cybersecurity needs, working in unison with our various divisions to deliver forward thinking vision to Clients as well as our organization as a whole.
* Supporting the organization’s consulting practice in delivering various IS027K, HITRUST, HIPAA, and NIST Compliant security services and consulting to our clients and the organization in whole with involvement by the Compliance Officer and Chief Information Security Officer.
* Completing tasks designated by company management in the delivery of our services.
* Executing client security plans, policy, and consulting supporting a program of security compliance and operational process improvement; utilizing technology and software tools to promote efficiency and breadth of service delivery.
* Orchestrating the planning of security compliance reports, preparation of security audit and compliance programs, performing testing procedures, drafting respective reports for presentation, and assessing management action plans.
* Performing Security Risk Assessments with the Compliance Officer and Chief Information Security Officer for the organization as a whole as well as Clients as required or requested.
* Gathering engagement-specific information and preparing work papers in accordance with company guidelines and industry accepted standards.
* Developing trusted relationships with IT Executives, C-Level contacts, and their respective Management teams in all engagements.
* Working directly with the Compliance Officer and Chief Information Security Officer for the organization as a whole as well as Clients as required or requested.

**Qualifications**
------------------


Preferred Certifications:


* Microsoft Certified Professionals (MCSE/MCSA/MCITP) – Server 2012/SharePoint/SQL Server/Exchange
* VMware Certified Professionals (VCP) – ESX 5.0/ESX 5.5/Horizon View
* Citrix Certified Engineer (CCE) - XenDesktop/XenServer
* Cisco Certified (CCNA/CCNP/CCIE) – Security/Wireless/VoIP/Switching
* Global Information Assurance Certifications (GIAC)
* Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
* Certified Information Security Manager (CISM)
* Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP)
* HealthCare Information Security and Privacy Practitioner (HCISPP)

Basic Qualifications and Experience:


* A minimum of 1 year of experience in a functional security role is preferred
* A Degree in Information Technology or Business Management is preferred
* Strong knowledge of Cybersecurity standards
* An overall understanding of security from endpoints, to gateways, and perimeter solutions.
* Specific skill with implementing SIEM solutions is preferred.
* Experience with IDS/IPS, Network Security, Gateway Security, and Endpoint Security..
* Strong Knowledge of HIPAA, HITRUST, ISO 27K, CoBit, NIST, PCI DSS, SAS70, and SSAE16 with the ability to apply that knowledge effectively as it relates to security.
* Experience with maintaining a working security environment that is IS027K, HITRUST, PCI DSS, HIPAA, and NIST Compliant.
* Experience with Healthcare Cybersecurity and Compliance Management is highly preferred.
* An excellent reputation for support to end-users must be demonstrated.
* Must have the ability to understand policy and protocol as they apply in real-world matters with Clients and the organization as a whole.
* Must have the ability to conduct and control audit, consulting, and compliance engagements.


For consideration please send the following: cover letter, resume, references, educational transcripts or certificates, and salary requirements to 

careers@crossroadstech.net

title: Summer Sales Intern
description:
Fish Window Cleaning has openings for **Summer Sales Interns** in the Greater Salt Lake area.  
  
Our cleaning services are in high demand for the 30,000+ businesses in our area. As an Sales Intern, you will visit these businesses during business hours this summer, Monday through Friday, and write estimates to clean their windows. Thats rightno nights or weekends!  
  
If you are friendly, self-motivated and would like the freedom of working without a boss looking over your shoulder all the time, this position is for you (especially if you have worked in hospitality or customer service). This is a terrific opportunity to try your hands at selling in a low-pressure, consultative sales environment. And we'll train you!  
  
We will pay you a per-estimate base rate as well as commissions on the job amount, so the more estimates you write, the more youll make. The average hourly equivalent for our salespeople is $18-22 per hour.  
  
We have an excellent work environment with great people. We will fully train you using our proven system so no experience is necessary.  
  
Fish Window Cleaning has grown to be the world's largest window cleaning company with more than 270 franchise territories in 44 states, yet we still maintain the traditional values we were founded on. We will always treat every customer as though they are our only customer.  
  
**Typical Schedule**: Mon-Fri, 9:00am 5:00pm  
  
Pay $18-22 per hour equivalent based on how many estimates you write/close  
  
**FISH offers:**  
* Paid training, no experience necessary
* Pay based on estimates written and closed
* No nights or weekends
* Flexible hours
* Full- or part-time available year-round
* Mentoring and other career-advancement opportunities

**Qualifications needed:**  
* Valid drivers license
* Reliable transportation to be used throughout the day
* Liability car insurance
* Provide excellent customer service
* Self-motivated and able to work alone most of the day

To get a feel for our business as seen through the eyes of our window cleaners, watch: https://youtu.be/OFUZoEv1URI

title: Summer Underwriting Intern
description:
Come to WCF Insurance, an innovative property and casualty insurance provider and be prepared to contribute, learn, and impact the company's success. You will get hand's-on experience while partnering with some of the industry's best. Network and collaborate with leaders from all areas to provide excellent customer service, building strong business partnerships, and keeping workers safe. We are headquartered in Utah and are growing in multiple states and have potential future openings in California, Arizona, Colorado, Idaho, and Nevada. 

**Position**

Come join WCF insurance for an educational hands-on approach to learning about insurance and mitigating risk. This is a **full-time (40 hours per week)**, **temporary** position that works out of WCF's Sandy, Utah headquarters with flexibility depending on the department. 

This position is a temporary position for Summer 2024. This intern will work in Large Commercial Underwriting. After the internship, there is a possibility of a part-time position as an apprentice. We offer full benefits starting at 20 hours per week after the internship. Graduate with the training and experience you need to have an exciting career in the stable field of insurance.

  
**Responsibilities**

The cohort interns will work with each other and each of our departments to learn insurance from many different angles. There will be weekly, paid training on different insurance terminology and weekly opportunities to share experience with others in your cohort. This intern will also have special projects and tasks designed to enhance the intern's knowledge of insurance operations and commercial underwriting. No prior insurance experience is required. 

  
**Qualifications**

The most qualified candidate will have:

* Currently enrolled or in a local college studying Math, Business, Economics, or related degrees, or already obtained a degree.
* Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite.
* Ability to handle confidential matters appropriately.
* Superb general written and oral communication skills.

Pay for this position is $17/hour. No benefits available for the internship position.

**WCF INSURANCE DE&I MISSION** Promote and embrace a diverse, inclusive, equitable, and safe workplace.

**WCF INSURANCE IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER** WCF Insurance provides equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees regardless of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability that can be reasonably accommodated, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state, or local law.

title: Software Engineering Intern, Network Security Group - Summer 2024
description:
**Software Engineering Intern, Network Security Group**

Juniper Networks is seeking students who are interested in Software Engineering Summer 2023 Internships. Candidates must be in enrolled in a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD program, preferably in EE, CS, or CE, graduating December 2024 or later.


We’re looking for Students who are excited about building infrastructure that global businesses rely on - robust, high-performance software. Our environment is highly collaborative, fostering learning and teamwork, and encouraging all Junivators to take ownership of our collective success.


The network security organization develops next-generation security products that enable efficient global communication. The team is seeking open-minded individuals with a track record of accomplishment and follow-through. Responsibilities and project areas vary by group. We recognize that you will bring your own unique skills and interests, and you will be matched to teams and projects accordingly.


For our software QA roles, we generally look for at least one of the following：


* Building (developing & testing) multi-service networking and network security products that are the foundation for the internet and its security.
* Working on hardware and virtual/containerized systems that secure networks
* Resolving internal and external customer issues.
* Interfacing with product management team, Development team, platform development team, and other teams responsible for the product development cycle.

Required background and skills:


* Currently pursuing a MS or PhD in EE/CE/CS, graduating December 2024 or later
* Strong programming fundamentals (e.g., C/C++, Python or other programming language), including the design and implementation of algorithms.
* Effective verbal and written communication; team player.
* Ability to come up with creative solutions to challenging problems
Knowledge of Networking (IP/TCP), routing, Security protocols (including but not limited to, IPSEC, IKE, BGP, OSPF, Firewalls, NAT, etc)  
* 

Preferred Qualifications and Interests:


* Familiarity with Routing protocols, Ethernet switching, IP forwarding, Class/Quality of service, Firewall & access control, TCP/IP, UDP
* Working knowledge of Operating Systems like Unix/Linux
* Working knowledge of Embedded System
* Working knowledge of Hardware Architecture
* Experience leveraging open source code
* Virtual Machine

In addition, you will join our comprehensive University Talent Program that fosters personal as well as professional growth, thoroughly preparing interns for the next step in their careers. Juniper internships are project-based, allowing interns to solve important problems, make lasting impacts on their teams, and contribute to the company’s overall objectives. Interns are mentored by some of the most talented and skillful innovators in the industry; you will connect with transformative thought leaders who promote disruptive ideas in their field. You will also participate in constructive professional workshops, company-wide community service initiatives, and an executive speaker series. You’ll build lasting friendships, expand your network, and connect with colleagues from around the world.


At Juniper Networks, you will not only have opportunities to build real-life, hands-on work experience – you’ll also have the chance to learn from the best and lay the groundwork for a successful career.


Minimum Salary: $61,875.00


Maximum Salary:$94,875.00


The pay range for this position is expected to be between $61,875.00 and $94,875.00/year; however, the base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position also includes medical benefits, 401(k) eligibility, vacation, sick time, and parental leave. Additional details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.


If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.


Juniper’s pay range data is provided in accordance with local state pay transparency regulations. Juniper may post different minimum wage ranges for permanent residency petitions pursuant to US Department of Labor requirements.

title: Security Analyst - Intern
description:
**Build Your Career at Informatica**


We're looking for a diverse group of collaborators who believe data has the power to improve society. Adventurous, work-from-anywhere minds who value solving some of the world's most challenging problems. Here, employees are encouraged to push their boldest ideas forward, united by a passion to create a world where data improves the quality of life for people and businesses everywhere.


**Security Analyst Intern**


We're looking for a **Security Analyst Intern** candidate with experience or interest in Information Security tooling, automation, and metrics to join our team in the Redwood City, CA office.


You will report to the Global Security Office – Sr Director Of Information Security.


You will work with our Governance, Risk and Compliance and Information Security Operations Center (SOC) teams to create automation and dashboards supporting automated reports on the security operations of our various compliance requirements.


**Technology You'll Use**


You will learn security and compliance tools like SIEM, Atlassian Confluence, Atlassian Jira, Wiki pages, PowerBI Reports, AuditBoard, ServiceNow, OneTrust, Centraleyes, and other SaaS tools. Candidates will have a chance to work in AWS, Azure, and On-premise environments.


**Your Role Responsibilities? Here's What You'll Do**  

  

You will be primarily responsible for working with Information Security and IT teams to develop and regularly report and analyze against Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for security services. Candidates will establish metrics for existing and new services and set up dashboards and metrics for ongoing security projects and programs, which may include:


* Develop, analyze, and execute security controls, defenses, and countermeasures to intercept and prevent internal or external attacks or attempts to infiltrate company email, data, e-commerce, and web-based systems.
* Assist in analyzing cybersecurity policies to control physical and virtual access to systems.
* Performs network security audits and testing and evaluates system security configurations to ensure efficacy and compliance with policies and procedures.
* Conduct penetration testing and vulnerability assessments of applications, operating systems, and networks.
* Research and evaluate cybersecurity threats.
* Assist in the creation and implementation of security solutions.
* Assist in developing and delivering highly compliant environments such as SOC2, ISO27001, HIPPA, UK cyber essentials, etc.
* Support the development of process and control improvements/automation/ consolidation opportunities.

**Knowledge & Skills**


* We are developing professional expertise and applying company policies and procedures to resolve various issues.
* Works on problems of moderate scope where data analysis requires a review of various factors.
* Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action.
* Partner within the team and build relationships with the Global Security Office (GSO) to accomplish objectives.
* Must be a junior or senior level college student, with an expected graduation of 2025 or later. Ideally you will reside in the SF Bay area or Austin TX area as you will work from our Redwood City CA or Austin TX office.  

  

This is a 12 week internship starting at the end of May or first of June 2024.

title: Internal Audit IT Intern
Information Security and Data Analytics Intern
description:
Say hello to possibilities.
Internship opportunities are important. You want to make sure you land a great one where you will learn A LOT. We're RingCentral and we’re happy you are considering an internship with us - we promise to make it worth your while.
First, a little about us, we’re the $2 billion global leader in cloud-based communications and collaboration software. We are fundamentally changing the nature of human interaction—giving people the freedom to connect powerfully and personally from anywhere, at any time, on any device.
This is where you and your skills come in. Join RingCentral as an intern this summer and say hello to opportunity.
Job Scope:* Support a complex project to develop Governance, Risk and compliance metrics and create a dashboard. The dashboards will provide key insights and visualizations to support decision-making and enhance the overall safety and security of our organization.
* Build domain knowledge of environment to understand long-term risk areas that could develop as the systems evolve
* High-level risk and issue analysis: Participate in the risk and findings in-depth analysis from technical standpoint and support with the overall risk treatment plan
* Assist in Cyber Security operations as needed including but not limited to assessments, reporting, documentation
* Support team by contributing in managing the GRC unified tool
* Generate security related artifacts as needed to meet internal and external compliance requirements


Qualifications:* Prior internship or experience working in a cloud-based communications company preferred
* Student pursuing undergraduate or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Technology, or a related field
* Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Jira to create dashboards
* Strong programming skills (e.g., Python, R) for data manipulation and automation
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
* Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work individually and in collaboration with the team
* Curiosity and motivation to take responsibility and to learn new things
* Proficient in Microsoft office tools/programs, Google suite
* Strong organizational, project management and time management skills.


Learning Skills/Outcomes:* Thorough understanding of Risk assessment framework and key Risk indicators (KRIs)
* Own and create risk dashboards for executives
* Learn to analyze risks to determine impact and remediation efforts
* Get familiar with various compliance frameworks, GRC tool


Availability:* Full-time [40 hours per week, 10 week internship]
* Must be available to start June 11, 2024
* Must be available to work on a hybrid schedule (3 days in office per week) in our Belmont, CA, or Dallas, TX office


About RingTern Program
Here are a few reasons to consider being a RingTern at RingCentral:  

1) You have a competitive edge and like to win. Here, you’ll compete for prizes with individual elevator pitches, team product challenges, off-site excursions and company events. We call it collaborative competition and it’s a great way to experience the way we work.
2) Major growth, for you and your career. RingCentral is growing at an annual rate of 10%. Every year. So now is a great time to join us. It also means there are lots of interesting, real-world challenges to help us solve.
3) Mentors who are in it for you. Our mentors will work with you to help you grow and achieve your goals. No micro-management and no busy-work. The goal is to help you problem-solve and succeed independently.
If you are interested in an internship here, chances are you have some relevant skills and are interested in working for a rapidly growing, cloud-based software and communications company. You bring the drive and passion to succeed and we’ll teach you the rest.
RingCentral’s Product and Technology team is the engine that drives our success. From Engineering and UX/UI to Product Management and CloudOps, this is the place where the biggest ideas in cloud communications are imagined, developed, and delivered. You’ll help create and deploy products that raise the technological bar, and power human connections. If you’re a talented, ambitious, creative thinker, RingCentral Product and Technology is the perfect environment to dream, produce and share your ideas with the world.
RingCentral’s work culture is the backbone of our success. And don’t just take our word for it: we are recognized as a Best Place to Work by Glassdoor, the Top Work Culture by Comparably and hold local BPTW awards in every major location. Our internship program is also award-winning - RippleMatch recognizes RingCentral as one of the top programs in the nation through their Campus Forward Awards. Bottom line: We are committed to hiring and retaining great people because we know you power our success. RingCentral offers on-site, remote and hybrid work options optimized for the ways we work and live now.
About RingCentral
RingCentral, Inc. (NYSE: RNG) is a leading provider of business cloud communications and contact center solutions based on its powerful Message Video Phone™ (MVP™) global platform. More flexible and cost effective than legacy on-premises PBX and video conferencing systems that it replaces, RingCentral® empowers modern mobile and distributed workforces to communicate, collaborate, and connect via any mode, any device, and any location. RingCentral is headquartered in Belmont, California, and has offices around the world.
RingCentral is an equal opportunity employer that truly values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
